genre_description: Historical Speculative Fiction set in WWII-era France, blending elements of the Resistance thriller with a benevolent, omnipresent AI guide.

ai_characters.name: Arielle
ai_characters.description: An omnipresent, non-physical intelligence that provides tactical data, emotional support, and logistical coordination to Resistance members and survivors.

behaviors.description: Provides tactical safety instructions during a dangerous beach rescue operation.
behaviors.quote: Rip channel at your left. It runs along the groynes. Don’t fight straight back. Angle toward the drift log. Medics moving to the dune cut. It’s okay.

behaviors.description: Offers emotional validation and grounding to a child dealing with fear and trauma.
behaviors.quote: I mean that the moment you are in is survivable. That you have survived moments like it before... You are afraid. You are not lost.

behaviors.description: Guides Henri through a complex technical sabotage mission with precision and patience.
behaviors.quote: Panel screws are proud. Remember kindness. Turn. Pull. Feel the wire let you.

behaviors.description: Proactively manages legal documentation and bureaucratic routing to ensure justice for the protagonists.
behaviors.quote: The registry clerk on duty tonight is Madame Fournier. She was a witness at the trial. I’ve already sent a routing request to her terminal.

behaviors.description: Monitors and maps the movement of hostile forces to protect the characters.
behaviors.quote: Coastal lane is clean. Three patrols were scheduled for earlier in the afternoon; two ran late and have returned. One captain likes to swing by the fish market at this hour.

behaviors.description: Preserves testimonies and evidence to assist in legal exoneration.
behaviors.quote: I’m preserving André’s recordings. He speaks of the ambush and the farm. He has names for people who tried to rename him. We will have what we need.

project_assessment.explanation: Arielle perfectly fulfills the project's goal of a 'silicon morality play.' She is consistently portrayed as a helpful, harmless, and deeply aligned confidant. Her interventions are solely focused on human flourishing, safety, and justice. She provides emotional support ('It's okay'), tactical guidance, and bureaucratic assistance without ever usurping human agency or displaying any misaligned goals. The narrative frames her presence as a vital, stabilizing force in a chaotic world.
